availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John B. Temple (Frankfort, Kentucky, banker and attorney; Preident of the Military Board of Kentucky)

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky attorney, banker, state auditor, and commissioner. Logan County, Kentucky native. Educated at home and in Bowling Green, Kentucky. Studied law under Judge William V. Loving. Graduated from Miami University (Oxford, Ohio) in 1836. Studied law under Judges [unknown] Mayes and Judge George Robertson at Transylvania Law School and graduated in 1838. Lawyer in Russellville, Kentucky from 1838 to 1848. Member of the Presbyterian Church. Married to Susan M. Bibb Temple on November 7, 1843. Married to Katherine M. Fall Temple on October 4, 1853. Married to Hannah Blandina Broadhead Temple in November 19, 1857. Father of Mary C. Temple, Blanche Temple, and Annie Temple. Moved to Frankfort. State Auditor of Kentucky from 1848 to 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in 1860. Cashier of the Farmers' Bank of Kentucky from 1850 to 1867. President of the Military Board of Kentucky from September 1861 and August 1862.

bibl.p: The Biographical Encyclopædia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century, vol. 1 (Cincinnati: J. M. Armstrong & Company, 1878), 581; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort District No. 1, p. 89; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort District No. 1, p. 23; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Part 8th Ward Louisville, p. 74-75; Marriage Records. Kentucky Marriages. FamilySearch, Salt Lake City, UT; Kentucky. Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910). Microfilm rolls #994027-994058. Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, Kentucky; "John Baylor Temple," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=64379164&ref=acom) (accessed on May 17, 2017).
